verses.roman:
dṛṣṭo vaḥ kaccid aśvattha
plakṣa nyagrodha no manaḥ
nanda-sūnur gato hṛtvā
prema-hāsāvalokanaiḥ

synonyms: dṛṣṭaḥ—has been seen; vaḥ—by you; kaccit—whether; aśvattha—O aśvattha (holy fig tree); plakṣa—O plakṣa (waved-leaf fig tree); nyagrodha—O nyagrodha(banyan tree); naḥ—our; manaḥ—minds; nanda—of Mahārāja Nanda; sūnuḥ—the son; gataḥ—has gone away; hṛtvā—after stealing; prema—loving; hāsa—with His smiles; avalokanaiḥ—and glances.
translation: [The gopīs said:] O aśvattha tree, O plakṣa, O nyagrodha, have you seen Kṛṣṇa? That son of Nanda Mahārāja has gone away after stealing our minds with His loving smiles and glances.
